rev.comment: /* Anarcho-capitalism */ sorry to step into your rv war, but neither version seemed accurate to me.
rv. Removing content through reversion is fun? And here I thought it was a last resort after all constructive effort fails.
having fun (that is, rv to npov version)
Sam Spade shows up to back VV, and neither will take it to the talk page, big surprise. 3rd/final revert for the day for me, have fun boys.
Reverting latest "restoring" of VVs personal POV to last version by albamuth
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ added link to anarchism vs capitalism article

/* See also */ added links to new articles
/* Modern anarchism */ - inserted 1st International ref. from other section, in preparation to move Anarchism and Marxism to separate article
Claiming that you have removed no useful content just because you don't like the content you removed is insincere VV. Reinserting needed edits needed to move away from POV presentation
i removed no useful content - see my previous edit summary; restoring one link
rv - minor wording changes were alright, but useful content should not have been removed.
Tentative attempt at wording pending further talk page discussion
rv - It was POV before, and traditional has been accepted by most editors. You are removing content that you don't like and claiming to be removing redundancy. Take it to talk page for once
/* Theoretical concepts */ - changed to concepts, as some of these are not theoretical at all
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ rm redundancy and verbiage; most -> many fervently
rv last edit; this is pov, old wording was fine, even if someone's forced their way on another page
Given that traditional is now accepted even on the anarcho-capitalist page, it would be better to replace the more problematic referances like this one
Arguably a forum is not the best thing to link to in this case, perhaps a document which gave similar data would work better.
The wider movement of anarchists disagree on this, not merely the ones who consider themselves left-wing
leftist in this context is inaccurate, many anarchists spurn the label
RedWolf - bypassing redirect: First World War
More redundancy, all of this is already said at the begining of the article
Despite its claim this link contains no description of Argentinean politics of present day, only historical descriptions and modern statistics.

I don't think anyone alleges that everyone in Christiania sells drugs, conversely I don't think anyone denies that some people do
More unnecessary stuff for the trash
Removing ultra-redundant third referance to Somalia
Already pretty well explained in the link
Removing some redundancy, actually much of this section is redundant

Moving out of place Stregheria referance to next section

rv, just because Kevehs is wrong doesn't mean the article has to be

Anarchy never means chaos, this is POV, reverted

rv - kevehs you no damn well this is unacceptable, quit the bs
The article is already more than twice the suggested length. His views can be summarized in the link. At this stage the article needs to be tightened, not made more diffuse.
Trying to cut this down to an acceptable length.
Stop, take this to the talk page if you have a problem. "The State" is -not- NPOV, it is the definition propped up by anarcho-capitalists to support their claim to anarchism.
rv - see the ~2000 pages of archived talk on this subject, we take an npov on the definition
Anarchism is against hierarchy, not JUST the state. Anarchy is not strictly anti-statism.
restore this to what it was
rv to anon's edit; someone sneaked in highly anti-capitalist pov, which was justly corrected

Temporary link for citation supplied, reinsert passage. Some do see strong correlations between taoism and anarchism, (see The Dispossessed and article in citation) thus it is relevant to page.
/* Precursors of anarchism */ rm dubious sentance w dead link as citation
replace "desirable" statement, it was redundant anyway
[[Image:blkred flag.png|thumb|right|The red-and-black flag, coming from the experience of anarchists in the labour movement, is particularly associated with anarcho-syndicalism.]]
/* Anarchism by region/culture */ - see also links to non-existant articles
/* Anarchism and the arts */ adds James Koehnline to anarchist collage artitists
adds external link to the Anarchist Encycopedia
That propaganda of the deed was unpopular is a fact evidenced by the tens of thousands of anarchists who did not engage in or support it compared to the handful that did - qualifier removed
There is no "particular" distinction that makes libertarian socialists less inclined to assassination politics than most other anarchist theories
Some individualists and egoists do not consider themselves socialists, yet do propose economic changes that could be considered very "radical"
CIA description is not necessarily adding to the previous one, so this fact has been clarified
That AC is the "utmost consequence" of classical liberalism is something that many classical liberals would disagree with, thus POV
The claim that anarcho-capitalism "draws from traditional anarchist thought" is controversial and under debate, thus not necessarily the best way to begin its description here, much less emphasized
Clarification on "anarcho-capitalism" as a theory which attempted to reform anarchism rather than merely adding to it
Removing redundant Aristippus sentence which already exists above, combining Zeno paragraphs
Agree with previous user on "unjustified coercion" - removing the word "all" - which combined with the "generally" at the begining does more than enough to qualify the statement
The -intentions- of anarchists on this matter are not theoretical, their intentions are for an actually desirable society and that is all that is being said here.
=Private property= : "traditions" -> "modern schools" since AC is still fairly young.
=The anarcho-capitalist perspective on property= IP is not necessarily natural
=[[Surrealism]]= Trim irrelevent facts, remove POV and pomp
